metadata.title: CVE-2018-6553 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The CUPS AppArmor profile incorrectly confined the dnssd backend due to useof hard links. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to escapeconfinement. This flaw affects versions prior to 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1 in Ubuntu18.04 LTS, prior to 2.2.4-7ubuntu3.1 in Ubuntu 17.10, prior to2.1.3-4ubuntu0.5 in Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, and prior to 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.10 inUbuntu 14.04 LTS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.1').
